intro: Ganophyllum obliquum, commonly known as the oblique ganophyllum, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and knotweed. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a smooth texture. Ganophyllum obliquum is often found in rocky or dry habitats, showing adaptability to harsh environmental conditions.
